title: Chicken Tikka Masala
instructions: Marinate the chicken with yogurt, garam masala, cumin, coriander, turmeric, chili powder, salt, garlic, and ginger. Let it sit for at least 1 hour.
In a pan, heat vegetable oil and sauté onions until golden brown.
Add the marinated chicken and cook until browned.
Add the tomato puree and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add heavy cream and simmer for another 5 minutes.
Serve with naan or rice.

title: Palak Paneer
instructions: Blanch the spinach leaves in boiling water for 2-3 minutes, then blend into a smooth paste.
In a pan, heat oil and sauté cumin seeds until they splutter.
Add chopped onions and cook until golden.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add the spinach paste, turmeric, garam masala, chili powder, and salt. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add water and cook for another 5 minutes.
Add paneer cubes and cream. Cook for 5 more minutes.
Serve hot with roti or rice.

title: Butter Chicken
instructions: In a pan, heat oil and sauté onions, garlic, and ginger until fragrant.
Add chicken pieces and cook until browned.
Add pureed tomatoes, garam masala, cumin, chili powder, and salt. Cook for 10 minutes.
Add butter and cream, simmer for another 10 minutes.
Serve with naan or steamed rice.

title: Vegetable Biryani
instructions: Wash and soak rice for 30 minutes. Drain and set aside.
In a pan, heat oil and sauté cumin seeds until fragrant.
Add onions and cook until golden brown.
Add chopped vegetables and cook for 5 minutes.
Add chopped tomatoes, garam masala, turmeric, chili powder, and salt. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add rice and water. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 20 minutes.
Serve hot with raita.

title: Chole Bhature
instructions: Cook chickpeas in a pressure cooker until soft.
In a pan, heat oil and sauté cumin seeds until they splutter.
Add onions and sauté until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, tomatoes, garam masala, turmeric, and red chili powder. Cook for 10 minutes.
Add cooked chickpeas and some water. Simmer for 15 minutes.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve with bhature.

title: Aloo Gobi
instructions: In a pan, heat oil and sauté cumin seeds until they splutter.
Add onions and cook until golden brown.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add turmeric, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Stir well.
Add potatoes and cauliflower. Cover and cook until vegetables are tender.
Serve hot with roti.

title: Daal Tadka
instructions: Cook lentils in a pressure cooker until soft.
In a pan, heat ghee and sauté cumin seeds until they splutter.
Add onions and garlic, cook until golden.
Add tomatoes, turmeric, chili powder, and salt. Cook for 10 minutes.
Add the cooked lentils to the pan and cook for 5 minutes.
Serve with roti or rice.

title: Samosas
instructions: Mix flour, ghee, and water to make a dough. Rest for 30 minutes.
In a pan, heat oil and sauté cumin seeds and onions until soft.
Add potatoes, peas, garam masala, turmeric, chili powder, and salt. Cook for 10 minutes.
Shape the dough into small balls, fill with the filling, and seal them.
Deep fry the samosas until golden brown.
Serve with chutney.

title: Methi Thepla
instructions: Mix all ingredients and knead into a soft dough.
Divide into small balls and roll out into thin circles.
Cook on a tawa until golden brown on both sides.
Serve with yogurt or pickle.
